Yoshinogawa Sake Dinner Brand of the Month: Tomatin Distillery About us At Grape'n Grain , we take pride in the quality of our products and the relationships we build with our clients. Our team of passionate wine enthusiasts has decades of combined experience, and we are dedicated to helping you find the perfect wine or spirit. We understand the importance of authenticity and origin, which is why we source directly from producers and store our products in temperature-controlled warehouses. Established in 1986, Fine Vintage Ltd. is a well-known importer of Fine Wine and Spirits in Hong Kong, and Grape n Grain was created to cater to the needs of private individuals searching for the best wines and spirits from both the old and new world. As an independent, privately owned company majority owned by Richard Paine and his wife Hiromi, the Fine Vintage team is made up of knowledgeable and passionate wine enthusiasts with decades of combined experience. We are unique in that we are one of the only wine & spirits distributors in Hong Kong to own our office, warehousing & bonded warehouse. We have strong experience in selecting, importing and distributing some of the finest wines and spirits of Europe and the â€œNew Worldâ€, representing mainly family-owned top producers who are well recognized and respected within the industry. We have developed close relationships with our producers and many of them have been represented by Fine Vintage for over 30 years. We have developed strong relationships with our clients with whom we have created decades of loyal partnerships. Our clients include leaders in the restaurant trade, hotels, private members clubs, specialist retail stores and direct to private customers in Hong Kong and Macau. Result No Result View All Result Home Business News and Economic Updates in Sebastian, Florida Grind & Grape in Vero Beach faces scrutiny over â€˜littered confettiâ€™ by Andy Hodges Jan 2, 2020 / 2:31 PM A A A A Reset Grind + Grape confetti from New Year's Eve in Vero Beach, Florida. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Residents and business owners in Vero Beach are asking Grind & Grape to clean up the confetti they left in the streets from their New Yearâ€™s Eve party. â€œMaybe head out on the streets and clean the mess that you did? What a shame. If they can clean up NY Times Square, then surely you could clean up this mess. Our town has a hard enough time keeping it clean from others you being a business out on the island is no exception,â€ Tracy Lynn Johnson wrote on Grind + Grapeâ€™s Facebook page. As of January 2nd at 2:00 p.m., the NYE confetti can be seen on the sidewalks and street. A patron reported that they shot off the confetti and filled the establishment and public street on January 1st. However, they never cleaned it up. â€œBe responsible and clean the mess up properly,â€ Susan McGuigan said. The pictures showing some of the confetti were posted on social media Thursday. Confetti littered on streets in Vero Beach. â€œWhy donâ€™t you go outside and clean your mess after your done? Ridiculous, and itâ€™s not safe. Yâ€™all should get fined,â€ Heather Johnson said. â€œHello, the street is still littered with the confetti you shot out all over it. Is it biodegradable? You are polluting our waters,â€ Leelee Havenlea wrote to Grind and Grape. â€œWhen are you going to clean up the streets? You made the mess, you should clean it up, donâ€™t you agree,â€ Cassie Beddow wrote on Facebook. Last year, we published a Grind + Grape review showing that their New Yearâ€™s Eve ball was still up during the month of March. Following the review, some patrons were banned by the establishment after they shared our review on Facebook. FEATURED EVENTS To add your event, call 772-925-5221. Try something else! about us Grind is a coffee company that lives in London. Weâ€™re on a mission to change the way we drink coffee for the better. Because with the amount of coffee we consume, we realised it would be nice to drink it with a clear conscience. And thereâ€™s nothing about our home-compostable pods that we feel guilty about. David Abrahamovitch, Founder & CEO. David is the founder & CEO of Grind. In 2011, alongside his friend Kaz James, he turned his fatherâ€™s old mobile phone store in Shoreditch into a coffee shop called Shoreditch Grind. As it evolved, Shoreditch Grind became a â€œcafÃ© by day and cocktail bar by nightâ€ and the first location became an East London institution. Over the last decade, Grind has grown to become the breakout coffee challenger brand in the UK, with fourteen locations across London, a thriving online business serving hundreds of thousands of customers around the world, and Grind coffee beans, coffee cans and coffee pods are available in most major UK grocers. Grind is also the global coffee supplier to Soho House, and is partnered with other best-in-class brands like Oatly and Brewdog. Davidâ€™s vision is to grow Grind into the world's leading challenger coffee brand, encouraging people around the world to enjoy speciality coffee, sustainably. @davidabrahamovitch David is the founder & CEO of Grind. In 2011, alongside his friend Kaz James, he turned his fatherâ€™s old mobile phone store in Shoreditch into a coffee shop called Shoreditch Grind. As it evolved, Shoreditch Grind became a â€œcafÃ© by day and cocktail bar by nightâ€ and the first location became an East London institution. Over the last decade, Grind has grown to become the breakout coffee challenger brand in the UK, with fourteen locations across London, a thriving online business serving hundreds of thousands of customers around the world, and Grind coffee beans, coffee cans and coffee pods are available in most major UK grocers. Grind is also the global coffee supplier to Soho House, and is partnered with other best-in-class brands like Oatly and Brewdog. Davidâ€™s vision is to grow Grind into the world's leading challenger coffee brand, encouraging people around the world to enjoy speciality coffee, sustainably. @davidabrahamovitch Howard Gill, Head of Coffee. Howard Gill is the Head of Coffee for cult London coffee brand Grind. Howey has worked in coffee for nearly 20 years and is a qualified Q grader. He joined the Grind team in 2016 when the company decided to set up their own roastery in London. Now, the roastery team has grown to include over 20 people, roasting hundreds of tonnes of coffee a year. Howey's coffee philosophy is based around inclusivity: he wants everyone to be drinking high quality, sustainable coffee. He designs Grind's blends to appeal to everyone, no matter how they like to drink their coffee. @coffeewithhowey Howard Gill is the Head of Coffee for cult London coffee brand Grind. Howey has worked in coffee for nearly 20 years and is a qualified Q grader. He joined the Grind team in 2016 when the company decided to set up their own roastery in London. Now, the roastery team has grown to include over 20 people, roasting hundreds of tonnes of coffee a year. Howey's coffee philosophy is based around inclusivity: he wants everyone to be drinking high quality, sustainable coffee. He designs Grind's blends to appeal to everyone, no matter how they like to drink their coffee. @coffeewithhowey This Is Better Coffee. Better Than What? Better than the mainstream coffee industry, which has become a major contributor to water pollution, deforestation, and exploitation (amongst other bad things that, unsurprisingly, we want absolutely no part of). Find out more Find out more Better For People & Planet. Our solution is to ethically source from small-scale producers who farm sustainably and pay their workers fairly. We make compostable coffee pods, we donâ€™t use single-use plastic, and all our packaging is fully recyclable. Learn more Learn more Better Taste. Grind coffee also tastes really, really good. Itâ€™s speciality-grade and roasted by us in London, and we have a team of experts trying and testing every batch. Our pods have an oxygen barrier that keeps your coffee fresh for months, without losing its flavour. Shop coffee Shop coffee Better (the best) Coffee Pods. We created the UKâ€™s first home-compostable coffee pod. This was (and still is) a big deal. Unlike so many aluminium and plastic pods that dominate the market, ours are made from plants. Theirs stick around for centuries; ours disappear in weeks. Read more Read more "Grind is rapidly taking over London." "The team at Grind have revolutionised the coffee game." "The Grind site is a mecca for caffeine-lovers." "Grind's subscription is consistently delicious." Shop all Visit us How We Got Here. Like all the best things in life, we began in Shoreditch. Now, weâ€™re all over London with 14 sites and our very own roastery, and we put a decadeâ€™s worth of coffee knowledge into home-compostable pods. About Us - The Grain and Grape Facebook Instagram YouTube Search The Grain and Grape Travel Photos, Stories, and Recommendations Travel Africa England, Scotland, Ireland Eastern Europe Northern Europe Southern Europe Western Europe Travel Tips Travel Itineraries Travel Planning Travel Tips by Destination Travel Books Foods of the World Living Abroad International Sports World Treasures About Us Contact About Us Hi everyone, Rob and Barbara here. A little about us: Two of our favorite things in life are traveling and spending time with friends, family, and meeting new people who become friends. We moved to Germany in August of 2021, and living abroad has certainly been an adventure. We started our website to share our stories with family and friends back home, and to have a travel diary with photos of our trips. Besides our collection of travel stories and tips , we have a page for foods of the world , which includes our culinary adventures and recipes we collect from around Europe. We also share some of our favorite books , both fiction and non-fiction, mostly around travel or food themes. Lastly, our page for living abroad includes local trips, international sporting events, and festivals around Germany. We love the feeling of home and fellowship that Irish Pubs all over the world offer. With this in mind, we try to style our stories to match the friendliness of the Irish, telling them as if we are sharing them with friends down at the pub . We hope that our site is either helpful, entertaining, or both. Cheers! We are so grateful for this opportunity to travel around Europe. Even the challenges of living in another country are an opportunity for growth. Sometimes we feel like we are semi-retired, because of the slower pace of life here. Often we dream of when we end this assignment and head back to the US. Buying a home after being an expat should be especially interesting. Weâ€™ll buy the first one that has air conditioning! Or a garbage disposal. For now, weâ€™ll remember to appreciate where we are and what we have. Meanwhile, we may look at living in another country. Italy always seems appealing! But enough about us. ğŸ˜Š Search by TOPIC International Sports Mini Adventures Albania Austria Belgium Croatia Czech Republic Denmark Egypt England Estonia Finland France Germany Greece Hungary Iceland Ireland Italy Latvia Liechtenstein Lithuania Luxembourg Malta Norway Poland Portugal Romania Scotland Slovakia Slovenia Spain Sweden Switzerland Tunisia Turkey The Grain and Grape provides travel photos, stories, and recommendations from around the world.
